main event: An Air National Guard pilot sighted an object consisting of two shiny globes connected by a solid rod proceeding in a southerly direction.
interesting points: The pilot attempted to overtake the object but was unable to distinguish any lights, vapor trails or exhaust smoke.
The pilot estimated the size of the object to be comparable to a Grumman Goose aircraft.
The description of the object is similar to reports of known upper air search balloons.
The fact that the object appeared to climb lends credence to the explanation of an upper air search balloon.
There is insufficient data to conclusively evaluate the sighting.
sighted object: two shiny globes connected by a solid rod
